Check what variables you have available in the project network$mtcars #> üìÅ Project:  #>    ‚îî üå± Root:am, carb, cyl, disp, drat, gear, hp, mpg, qsec, vs, wt #>  #> üîó  Joins: (None)  # 2. retrieve data from the network data <- query(mtcars = c("hp", "wt")) |> nascent(network)  # 3. write the transformation step add_power_to_weight <- function(data) {   data$power_to_weight <- data$hp / data$wt   data }  # 4. register the step back into the network network$mtcars$link(add_power_to_weight(data = query(mtcars = c("hp", "wt")))) network$mtcars$link(fun = add_power_to_weight(data = query(mtcars = c("hp", "wt"))),                     vars = "power_to_weight", update = TRUE) # Note: Setting update = TRUE prevents the network from asking # whether an already registered function should be updated. network$mtcars #> üìÅ Project:  #>    ‚îú üå± Root:am, carb, cyl, disp, drat, gear, hp, mpg, qsec, vs, wt #>    ‚îî üõ† Layer 1: power_to_weight #>  #> üîó  Joins: (None)

title: Introduction to xafty
text: many workflows, temporarily group data downstream transformations can operate group-level context. typical dplyr pipeline, simple calling group_by(), performing transformation, calling ungroup(). xafty network pipeline, however, grouping must attached contexts project. nodes independent assembled dynamically, grouping embedded inline within function. Instead, xafty lets define grouped execution contexts project level using entry exit hooks. project can automatically group data node entered ungroup node finishes, allowing transformation functions assume grouped input without containing grouping logic . start defining three pass-functions: Next, create new context attach variable: Using on_entry on_exit hooks, specify functions run. Setting parameter {.data}, pass entire data.frame parameter. Currently, works entry exit nodes. Now, register node attach context per_gear inherits grouping behavior run.
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  group_by_gear <- function(data) {   group_by(data, gear) }  ungroup_data <- function(data) {   ungroup(data) }  add_mean_hp_per_gear <- function(data) {   mutate(data, mean_hp_per_gear = mean(hp)) } network$mtcars$add_context("per_gear",                             on_entry = group_by_gear(data = query(mtcars = "gear")),                             on_exit = ungroup_data(data = "{.data}")) network$mtcars$link(add_mean_hp_per_gear(data = query(mtcars = "hp")), attach_context = "per_gear")  data <- query(mtcars = c("gear", "mean_hp_per_gear")) |>    nascent(network)  head(data) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 2 #>    gear mean_hp_per_gear #>   <dbl>            <dbl> #> 1     4             89.5 #> 2     4             89.5 #> 3     4             89.5 #> 4     3            176.  #> 5     3            176.  #> 6     3            176.

title: Introduction to xafty
text: States provide mechanism parameterizing network execution query time. allow expose configurable values, styling options, thresholds, model parameters, without hard-coding transformation functions objects. States defined network using add_state() may optionally specify default value (default value set, network use NULL default): defined, state can referenced inside function using name wrapped curly braces: assign concrete value state specific execution, use xafty::with_state() constructing query: States turn otherwise rigid network flexible execution framework. enable network structure produce different outputs without modification, providing high-level controlled way adapt results specific use case.
code: network$add_state("date_state", default = Sys.Date()) add_date <- function(data, date = NULL) {   data$date <- date   data }  network$mtcars$link(add_date(data = query(mtcars = "am"),                               date = "{date_state}")) data <- query(am, mean_hp_per_gear, date) |>    with_state(date_state = "2026-02-02") |>    nascent(network) head(data, n = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 3 #>      am mean_hp_per_gear date       #>   <dbl>            <dbl> <chr>      #> 1     1             89.5 2026-02-02 #> 2     1             89.5 2026-02-02 #> 3     1             89.5 2026-02-02

title: Introduction to xafty
text: xafty constructs join paths using greedy best-first-search algorithm. approach works well long join relationships network unambiguous. network grows additional projects joins added, however, automatically selected join path may longer match intended data flow. explicitly control joins resolved, can attach predefined join path query using xafty::add_join_path(): formally, multiple join paths can defined single query: configuration results two joins applied: projectA joined projectB, projectA joined projectC. Explicit join paths provide reliable way control join behavior complex networks help prevent unintended join resolutions network evolves.
code: data <- query(mtcars = "power_to_weight", engine = "type") |>    add_join_path(path = c("mtcars", "engine")) |>    nascent(network)  head(data, n = 3) #>   power_to_weight    type #> 1        41.98473 V-Shape #> 2        38.26087 V-Shape #> 3        68.62745 V-Shape qry <- query(projectA = "col1", projectB = "col2", projectC = "col3") query_join <- add_join_path(qry, join1 = c("projectA", "projectB"),                              join2 = c("projectA", "projectC"))

code: get_mtcars <- function() {   data("mtcars", envir = environment())   mtcars }  add_power_to_weight <- function(mtcars) {   mtcars$power_to_weight <- mtcars$hp / mtcars$wt   mtcars }  get_engine_details <- function() {   engine <- data.frame(     type = as.factor(c("Straight", "V-Shape")),     vs = c(1, 0)   )   engine }  join_engine_details <- function(mtcars, engine) {   joined <- merge(mtcars, engine, by = "vs", all.x = TRUE, sort = FALSE)   joined }  plot_mtcars <- function(mtcars) {  mtcars_plot <- plot(mtcars$type, mtcars$power_to_weight)  mtcars_plot }  # Assemble the pipeline mtcars_plot <- function() {  mtcars <- get_mtcars()  engine <- get_engine_details()    mtcars <- join_engine_details(mtcars = mtcars, engine = engine)  mtcars <- add_power_to_weight(mtcars = mtcars)    plot_mtcars(mtcars = mtcars) } # Run the pipeline mtcars_plot()

code: ## Preparation:  # Make sure that the functions from step 2 are loaded into memory. ## /Preparation  library(xafty)  # Initialize the network with the desired structure xafty_network <- init_network("example_network", projects = c("mtcars", "engine"))  ## Register the functions in project "mtcars" ##  # The function `get_mtcars()` is registered as a root node in the project "mtcars". xafty_network$mtcars$link(get_mtcars())  # Instead of passing data to `add_power_to_weight`, we register a dependency using query() xafty_network$mtcars$link(add_power_to_weight(mtcars = query(mtcars = c("hp", "wt"))))  ## Register the function `get_engine_details()` in project "engine" ## xafty_network$engine$link(get_engine_details())  # Finally, we register the join between the two projects,  # by passing two separate queries to the respective parameters xafty_network$mtcars$link(join_engine_details(mtcars = query(mtcars = "vs"),                                               engine = query(engine = "vs")))  # Inspect the network xafty_network #> --- #> üìä example_network  #>  #> üå≤ Projects (2): #>    ‚îúüìÅ mtcars #>    ‚îÇ   ‚îî  12üå± | 1üîó | 0üß©  #>    ‚îîüìÅ engine #>        ‚îî  2üå± | 0üîó | 0üß©  # Inspect a project xafty_network$mtcars #> üìÅ Project: mtcars #>    ‚îú üå± Root:am, carb, cyl, disp, drat, gear, hp, mpg, qsec, vs, wt #>    ‚îî üõ† Layer 1: power_to_weight #>  #> üîó Joins (1): #>    ‚û°Ô∏è engine  # Pull data as needed from the network in the desired column order query(hp, wt, vs, type, power_to_weight) |>     from(mtcars) |>    nascent(xafty_network) |>    head() #>    hp    wt vs    type power_to_weight #> 1 110 2.620  0 V-Shape        41.98473 #> 2 110 2.875  0 V-Shape        38.26087 #> 3 245 3.570  0 V-Shape        68.62745 #> 4 180 4.070  0 V-Shape        44.22604 #> 5 175 3.440  0 V-Shape        50.87209 #> 6 180 3.780  0 V-Shape        47.61905 query(type, hp) |> from(mtcars) |> nascent(xafty_network) data <- query(power_to_weight, type) |>            where(hp >= 100) |>            from(mtcars) |>            nascent(xafty_network)  plot_mtcars(mtcars = data)
